website_summaries.verdict: A good value for the money, this blade features carbide-tipped teeth for a smooth, fast cut and longer life.
pros: This durable, well-made blade is excellent for making factory-like edge cuts easily and quickly
Designed for all high-gauge metal with anti-vibration vents for straighter, truer cutting
cons: Not advisable for cutting thicker metal

customer_reviews.title: Cut 20+ Sheets of Hardibacker and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I was building an outdoor kitchen and I needed lots of concrete board but the reviews on most of these blades where not great. Either very expensive or short life. I was skeptical but I went with this blade and was impressed I needed to cut.... 8x - 4x8 1/4 inch sheets of hardibacker 10x - 3x5 1/4 inch sheets of hardibacker 5x - 3x5 1/2 inch sheets of hardibacker. All boards required cutting and this one blade cut them all with ease. Even after all that cutting it cut just as smooth and clean as the first cut. See picture...lots of cuts needed. Wear glasses and dust mask this stuff is bad for your lungs
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: White Vinyl fencing
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to rip cut and miter cut vinyl fencing. This was a great blade for the job. I had one on my miter saw and one on the table saw, both worked flawlessly without any chipping. Just make sure the blades are at top rpm and slow, steady cuts, no need to rush.
customer_reviews.author: Fish

customer_reviews.title: Irwin should be good
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Irwin 180 tooth 10 inch table saw blade July 2, 2018. I put it in my saw for the first time yesterday February 12, 2019. I needed it to be able to saw miter joints for framing. To my surprise the blade has a warp in it and does not cut perfectly. It is past the return point. I often buy stuff for my shop that may not get used for a long time. I guess I have been had.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Nan

customer_reviews.title: I am quite amazed by this blade
customer_reviews.text: I am quite amazed by this blade. I'm not sure how long it will last but I've been able to cut the angle iron from an old bed-frame, random pieces of 11 gauge steel, and some square tubing. I had upgraded my miter saw to 12 inch a few years ago and had an old 10-inch miter saw sitting around. The old one is now set up with this blade and serves as the metal cutting saw. I will be ordering this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Mashed Potato

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife thru butter.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts steel roofing like a hot knife thru butter. Cut 29 gauge steel ribbed roofing easily. Cut five sheets at a time in some cases. No jagged edges. Fine finish. Didn’t dent, snag or bind at all. Put and entire roof on by 16x20 pergola. Did not lose sharpness at all.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works well with acrylic and would recommend! A+
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these blades to cut my acrylic without any problems at all. Cuts the acrylic well and doesn't crack the material, which is always a good thing when you are working with plastic. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: nmspecialist

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic blade!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase a metal cutting blade for my Milwaukee 7-1/2" M18 circular saw to make quicker cuts and I'm glad I went with this blade. I was hesitant to use it on 3/16" and 1/4" thick steel square tubing but it cut through them like butter!
customer_reviews.author: CW115

customer_reviews.title: the blade that could
customer_reviews.text: this blade worked really well on bamboo flooring. i went through 2 of them but any one in flooring will tell you bamboo is one of the hardest floors made. it did the job at a cheap price. i dont know if this blade could stand up to construction site demands, but if you have some wood cutting jobs and you dont want to spend $50-100 for one blade, try one of these first. i will keep a couple of these on hand, on softer wood i think you can get a lot of cuts out of one blade.
customer_reviews.author: birdysfriend

customer_reviews.title: Wear eye, face, arm protection!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts through roof/sheet steel like it’s cutting through 1/4 inch plywood. I’ll NEVER cut sheet metal with a cutting sheer again, this things makes this process much quicker, easier, and you get a straight precise cut when you’re finished. DO NOT use this blade without proper eye, face, and even arm protection, this thing throws tiny pieces of razor blade slivers everywhere. I can’t imagine using this blade without protective gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Dull dull dull!
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my chop saw to cut baseboard mouldings. From the first cut the blade struggled to cut through baseboard! The blade would heat up and burn the wood. Totally unacceptable from a brand new blade. I do not recommend this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: DIY home user here. How many liner feet am I really going to need a finer tooth saw blade for? So far, I've put a solid 9 feet on this blade. Maybe it will see another 10 next year. Point being, I wanted an affordable blade to get my project done, and this blade fit the bill perfectly. It's probably far more capable of making good cuts than both the clapped out saw it was used on as well as the operator using it.
customer_reviews.author: jeffw

customer_reviews.title: 4 Cuts......
customer_reviews.text: My first cut was on some light angled aluminum. Did pretty well. To be expected, considering the same can be done with a regular wood blade. The next piece to be cut was the actual work I purchased this for; 3" X 2" angle mild steel. This blade lasted all of 3 cuts before it was done. About midway through the cut, it only heated up the part. After stopping it, it was very dull to the touch. Ended up having to by a Japanese Evolution blade. Now that's a blade. Still cutting without any issues. More than what can be said for the Irwin crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used Quite a Bit! Still a good blade!!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review on this blade several months ago when I bought it. I couldn't say much positive or negative about it at the time as I had only used it once. Now I have used it quite a bit. I've used it for general cutting and also for cutting out some nasty old particleboard flooring. It's still a good blade! When it needs sharpening, I'll probably just buy another one as I don't know anybody who sharpens carbide.
customer_reviews.author: BAD EXAMPLE

customer_reviews.title: Quick Clean Cut
customer_reviews.text: This IRWIN Metal Cutting Circular Saw Blade saved our project. We purchased for cutting tin roofing/siding for our barn. While our manufacturer recommends NOT using a circular saw due to burning from flying metal shards, we found the power and hand snips to difficult to get past groves/profile of the tin. Using the circular saw, and cutting from the back, and cleaning any metal shavings right away seems to have worked. It has been months with no rust pitting nor observable finish damage. Highly recommend. Also, was initially worried the blade would dull after the first cut or two, but the Irwin metal curring blade held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: I love my new blade!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my first miter saw and unfortunately it didn’t come with a blade. I’m glad I decided on this one after researching several brands and styles. The cuts are so smooth as if they’ve seen sanded and painted over with a clear stain. I’m very happy with the crisp cuts it produces. I’m definitely going to check out their other blades when I have other DIY projects in my future!!
customer_reviews.author: Adria

customer_reviews.title: Great blade for ripping hardwoods
customer_reviews.text: I use this blade to rip a straight edge on rough cut hardwood lumber to prep it for the jointer. It'll cut through 9/4 cherry, maple and walnut surprisingly well, much better than you'd expect from a little 7.25" blade in a circular saw. This blade isn't for ripping finish plywood however, as it'll really rough up the cut edge.
customer_reviews.author: Stinkysquishy

customer_reviews.title: Good blade for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like to do a lot of weekend woodworking projects with hardwoods. I have purchases the Irwin from my local tool store but they don't carry as many blades as they used to because they have switched to internet sales. I have used this blade for about five years, it resharpens nicely and I get a double life out of the blade. It is a good blade and makes very smooth cuts. In fact, sometimes I prefer using the saw blade to the jointer.
customer_reviews.author: commerce555

customer_reviews.title: Deep scratches in the end grain.
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional trim carpenter and thought I'd give this blade a try on my miter saw. Purchased this blade because it has a high ATB grind. The Marples blade was very sharp and breezed through primed 1x6 and 1x8 pine with no tear out. The blade ran true with absolutely no wobble. However there were very deep scratches in the end grain after the cut. I am currently doing a lot of trim jobs with butt joints around the windows and doors with end grains exposed. I can only use this blade on jobs that require all mitered joints with no exposed end grains.
customer_reviews.author: tony p.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice crosscut/general purpose blade
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality of cuts, both rip cuts and crosscuts. This blade lives in my table saw most of the time and performs very well, especially for the price. Cut quality is better than the Diablo 40 tooth combo blade from Home Depot. This won't replace a dedicated rip blade if you need to make a lot of rip cuts, nor will it replace an 80 tooth combination blade when you want chip-out free cuts in delicate materials, but for day-to-day use in the shop, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Sick!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this blade slices through plywood sheets like butter. Love this blade! Very rare something so affordable works so well! Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 18v cordless firestorm circular saw. I've already used it on 2x4s and plywood, and it cuts quickly, cleanly, and with a smaller kerf than my 7 1/2" circular saw. It is still a rough cut blade, so you may have tear off, so know that going in. I'd knocked some of the carbide bits off my old blade and while it still cut, this is a huge improvement, even from when my old blade was brand new. Highly recommend this blade.
customer_reviews.author: warwizard99

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like hot knife through butter.  Heavy quality blade.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, first cut was like hot knife through butter. So clean and nice. However this blade is quite heavier than the one I replaced. So I noticed the motor working harder to get the blade up to speed and I could certainly feel much stronger gyroscopic forces. But still happy to be getting such clean cuts. Should have bought it earlier. Made in Italy. I don’t see that often.
customer_reviews.author: Koroush Saraf

customer_reviews.title: Not Much Life to this Product...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw blade to replace the one that came on my Northern Tools Ironton 14" steel blade dry chop saw. It operates at 1350 RPM, free spinning, and slightly slower when cutting metal. I bought the blade in February of 2019, have cut maybe 15-20 pieces of hot rolled 1/8" steel. It lasted maybe, 10% of the original blade's work load. Even when used as recommended, it is not worth the expense. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: A Tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Wood is like butter again.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how dull my old blade was until I saw that I was burning through wood rather than cutting it. I hated using my circular saw and found ways to just .. not use it. I ordered this blade on a whim just hoping. Oh man. It's like cutting butter with a hot knife again. My circular saw is useful again! Like it used to be. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut some Hardie trim for a repair job. Looked at a lot of blades and reviews before deciding on this one. Although I didn't have a huge amount of cutting to do, I was impressed by the job it did! Having read about fiber cement being very messy (dusty) and chewing up blades quickly, I was pleasantly surprised! The dust level was much lower than expected and the last cut went as smoothly as the first! Very clean and consistent cuts. From my somewhat limited experience with this blade, it appears to be a very good value!
customer_reviews.author: J. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend, very loud and hard to control
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a better cut then the 4-1/2" metal cutting blade I use on my angle grinder. I was wrong, this blade is wider then my angle grinder blade and does not leave a nice cut. Very messy alot of burr, I did not like what I saw so I went back to my thinner composit blade and was very satisfied, I should have just stayed with the tried and true, more control and quieter.
customer_reviews.author: weed wacker

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: this is so much better than the Avanti crapshoot Home Depot carries it's not even fair. This only costs a few bucks more and it zips through fiber cement board so easily you'll think you had a ripping blade on it. I even forgot I had this one my circular saw in between siding jobs and ripped a bunch of OSB for sheathing and didn't realize I had the blade on until I wanted to change blades for siding. It's a BEAST!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Vinyl fencing and railings
customer_reviews.text: Great for vinyl fencing. Used it to cut up a bunch of old vinyl fencing and to cut some new railings for a composite deck. Gives really smooth cuts. Works on wood as well but not very well unless you go extremely slow. Can’t fault it there though as the large number of teeth make this a stand out blade for vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: You need to know ferrous from non ferrous
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this blade I was freaked out how it cut a 1/2 metal sheet (a little at a time) almost like cutting a piece of wood. I was elated. Then the next piece I was brought back down to earth as it really beat up the blade. I don't know much about different kinds of metal but after this one the blade was pretty much junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy's

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the old blade on my radial arm saw. Blade works great. Cuts nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I have a DeWalt 12 inch chop saw. Tried the blade, poor results. The negative hook design pulls the moulding into the blade, leaving multiple ridges. I had to re-cut every piece. I wish the designers of blades and power tools would field test them before going into production. I returned it and ordered a Forrest instead.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Guancione

customer_reviews.title: Received used product...thanks!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was just a few cosmetic flaws, which wouldn’t have been a big deal then I realized the spacer rings were seized together from heat. I could only pry two of them off, the rest were melted together. Not sure who to blame.. replacement ordered will update review when new blades received.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good blade for metal
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut 24 Ga. metal roofing, and it cut it like butter. The cut was smooth and very little sparking. I made a jig out of some plywood to get a straight cut across my metal pieces. I only needed it to cut a few pieces, so I don't know how long it will hold up on a big job. It did what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This blade stopped cutting after about 6 cuts in mild 1 x 1/4 bar stock. I am a handy man that does a fair amount of welding. It bothered me to spend $150.00 on Milwaukee's 14" blade so I have been trying others. Nothing comes close. Their blades are expensive but on a cost per cut basis, they are the best value. Shop around. They are available for under 150.
customer_reviews.author: rwischkin

customer_reviews.title: This blade motors thru roofing metal.
customer_reviews.text: This blade does a great job of cutting roof and siding metal. Two things to watch for. First it creates a lot of small metal particles so eye protection is a must. Secondly if you leave those small particles on the metal they will leave rust spots almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Rockdoc

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost option for general duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit as a low cost option to cut up several old sheets of 1/2 plywood. While these sheets were water damaged made at minimum 20-25 4 foot long cuts with no noticeable slowdown or resistance. While the blade did not a finish edge, the cuts were able to be made very rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: G. VO

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few extra bucks on a nicer blade that lasts longer.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought many saw blades in my life, including from Irwin. I’ve never had such a terrible experience in my life. The blade dulled after only a few uses finishing some miter cuts. After a few more uses it seemed to warp slightly as my cuts were no longer straight. I switched back to my old blade and had no problems finishing my project but had to run to the hardware store and buy a new finishing blade. I recommend spending a few extra bucks on a blade that will last. I got about 60 mins of cutting out of this before it was completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Metal cutting
customer_reviews.text: This blade works great! I use the blade for cutting metal closet door rails. Prior to getting the blade, I would use a pipe saw, which would work but was tough to get a straight cut. The Irwin blade cuts quickly, cleanly and is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: really nice smooth cuts on 24 gauge kynar metal cladding and ...
customer_reviews.text: really nice smooth cuts on 24 gauge kynar metal cladding and flashing. Recommended by local metal manufacture as type of blade to use for field cutting. Will not burr the metal (ie cause the paint to heat and remove protection from metal causing rust). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Warner

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Have only made a couple cuts so can’t speak to much about the blade but if that “Made in Italy” is part of your decision to purchase this blade try another brand. Bought directly from Amazon so it isn’t a knock off blade. They moved the manufacturing plant and haven’t updated any of their marketing material.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lind

customer_reviews.title: Dunno
customer_reviews.text: Threw this blade in a HF 10 miter saw. First cold-cut blade for me but I'm cutting a bunch of small pieces of 16 gauge 1/2" square tubing. First cuts quick and clean but after 20 I had heat and glow. Could be operator error - I may have let it work too long (like an abrasive wheel) rather than using it like a saw blade. My project couldn't be done in my shop without it but I may try a different blade next time. Not bad but an expensive consumable.
customer_reviews.author: Hudibras

customer_reviews.title: Strong, durable, cuts corrugated steel like a hot knife thru soft butter!
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw blade to cut corrugated steel when residing my large garage. Then I used it to do my daughter and son in laws large garage. It never got dull at all even when I used it to cut some 2 x 4 s because I didn't want to waste time switching my saw blade. Well worth the money and saved time because it cut so awesome! Just be sure to wear safety goggles and long sleeves because of the tiny metal pieces that spray as you cut the steel.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Four of these grouped make a perfect 1/4 Kerf.
customer_reviews.text: I installed four of these onto my 10" shop table saw, ran a piece of wood across them and mic'ed the result. Ended up with a perfect 1/4 wide cut.
customer_reviews.author: Barney Rubble

customer_reviews.title: Great for vinyl
customer_reviews.text: This thing slices through vinyl siding like butter. I used a standard construction blade installed backwards to cut the siding for my garage, it worked okay, but when I started on my house I decided to buy a dedicated blade. I have no regrets. Nice clean cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: So far it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use on plywood and MDF. So far it has yielded nice clean cuts for the most part. Definitely helps to score the line, and set blade depth correctly. Tape can help, but doesn't seem a huge improvement over scoring anyway. Could you find better? Probably. Would it cost more? Probably.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Just what is needed for cutting plastic
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fine tooth saw blade to trim plastic modular flooring and not leave a jagged, melted or torn edge. This blade made a nice smooth cut as long as you did not try and cut to quickly. Good price and good blade.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, good value
customer_reviews.text: I love this dado set. Fits tightly to my spindle, exceedingly accurate cuts and description of exactly which parts need to be installed for the width required is spot on. The cuts are crisp, sharp and square. Great tool and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: ELJ_62

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting metal siding/roofing!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut used metal roofing to length to re-side my dad's old outbuilding. Lots of sparks and hot pieces, so wear long sleeves and safety glasses - but this is the best thing since sliced bread!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aarron H.

customer_reviews.title: Not made in Italy
customer_reviews.text: Order two of these blades and was disappointed that they are made in China. Called Irwin to check it the ones made in Italy was still available, but Irwin was brought out by Stanley. All the these blades are now made in China! Not the same blade like one of the reviews show a picture of, probably send one of the blades back, and try one while I have the old ones I have sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for plywood
customer_reviews.text: Might work for a super thin veneer, but it binds up on 1/4" plywood.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a blade for my table saw to cut 2" Hardwood. This was perfect for my project and you can't beat it foe the money.
customer_reviews.author: SCADSS

customer_reviews.title: Good Blade
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the supplied blade on a Milwaukee M12 circular saw with this blade. I had to noticeably push the Milwaukee blade through cuts. This blade cuts through PT and other lumber with minimal resistance. Great upgrade and very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: wrpercival

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Blade become dull after light use, also not as rigid , very thin metal
customer_reviews.author: Garik

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on all the good reviews, however my experiences is bad, first time use, will not cut 5/8" Plywood, at first I thought it was me I checked everything, no good, I also discovered the Blade is not flat, it has a very bad High spot both sides, same place. stick with buying good quality at a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got this saw to cut my counter top for installation of a drop in cooktop. I taped up the top and measured then started cutting. It went right through and didn't cause a bunch of chips - which is why I bought this 140 tooth saw. So I am happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: No signs of dulling after several feet of cutting.
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut 29 gauge roofing metal. Made roughly 50 cuts about three feet wide as well as two full length (20 feet) cuts and last cut was as clean as the first. WEAR EYE PROTECTION! Have anyone assisting you to WEAR EYE PROTECTION as this blade definitely will throw material removed from the cutting process. A nibbler would be safer but this blade really cuts quick.
customer_reviews.author: IPHONE USER

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic blade. I use it with my M12 Milwaukee circular saw. I will for sure get another when this one wears out. I've cut a lot of 2x material as well as 3/4 ply and MDF. Highly recommend. I love Irwin paddle bits as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Borchert

customer_reviews.title: Quality circular saw blade, sharp and clean.
customer_reviews.text: Priced better than in brick and mortar stores and item was received quickly. Seems to cut quuck and clean, and works great with my old school Black & Decker Industrial worm drive circular saw. I've used this blade to cut a lot of dimensional wood while building a new fireplace surround, mantle, and header in my house. Irwin is a reputable name and I expect that this blade will last a long time before needing sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but it works
customer_reviews.text: The price was what caught my attention and why I purchased it. However it’s performance wasn’t as good as I expected. Not completely disappointed but will be more cautious in the future when something is exceptionally less expensive
customer_reviews.author: GLH

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works
customer_reviews.text: Doing a bunch of corrugated panel work. This blade cuts like a knife through butter (well maybe not quite like butter) but it cuts really well and fast. It does throw metal chips out so be prepared for that with safety goggles. Also hearing protection is advised. Also as with any sharp metal I recommend you wear gloves. Would buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Alan Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: R-Panel Galvanized Roofing sheets
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit on my 7 1/4" circular saw. Smooth and easily cuts 18 ga. Galvanized R-panel galvalume sheet roofing like a hot knife through butter. Finish cut looks like a factory edge. This blade would easily cut multiple sheets at the same time. Best blade I have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: Lois & Billy Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for 3 hours
customer_reviews.text: Got dull so fast. Couldn't even complete a project. Lasted about 2 hours. At first was cutting like a knife through butter. Then just stopped cutting at all
customer_reviews.author: Valerios S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for vinyl siding
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good blade for vinyl siding. I am siding my 1400SF home and this blade has been perfect. I have cut roughly 300 times with it and it is still as sharp as the first cut. Just remeber for cleaner cuts install the blade backwards. No chips or melting on any piece.
customer_reviews.author: Darknight

customer_reviews.title: I buy these for jobs that require some abuse.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to abusing your higher quality blades. I keep two circular saws, one with these blades, another with high quality blades. They get the job done without bankrupting you.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Archibald

customer_reviews.title: no good
customer_reviews.text: Product warped form heat buildup after first few cuts making it dangerous for kickback. Returned and got a good one at Orange store.
customer_reviews.author: Uncagedredbird

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.  INAUTHENTIC CHINESE BLADES.  NOT AUTHENTIC ITALIAN MARPLES BLADES.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three of these for table saws and miter saws. We have been using the real Italian Marples blades for several years. The blades we received are NOT REAL MARPLES blades. They are chinese knock-offs. JUNK. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Property Management of Louisville

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blade to cut 1/4" Plexiglas. It worked quickly and made nice smooth cuts. Made job very easy. Recommend highly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Millard E Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Good cutting product
customer_reviews.text: These work very well, but They wear down quickly on the hardwoods that I use
customer_reviews.author: LZafft

customer_reviews.title: Works great on metal roofing
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut a bunch of metal roofing. I cut some sheets one at a time, and I also cut stacks of about 10 sheets. All the cuts were nice and clean. You will want to have hearing protection when using this thing on sheet metal, it is very loud. You definitely need eye protection also, probably a face shield. I tried just using safety glasses but it was throwing way too many metal particles in around the glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Don & Darcy

customer_reviews.title: It makes nice clean cuts
customer_reviews.text: Used on Makita 5007NB 7 1/4" saw. This thing is expensive and its worth it to me. I'm cutting metal roofing. It makes nice clean cuts, is easily controllable and does not "grab" material in the cut. It does throw the debris, so be sure to wear your safety glasses and gloves too, depending how you're holding your saw. I'm unsure of the durability as I have not cut that much and the blade appears untouched so far.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet

customer_reviews.title: he likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a blade he had used for many years...he liked the first one, so we bought another just like it!
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Fast, clean cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blade to cut metal liner panel for the inside walls of my shop - I does that job well. It leaves very clean edges and very little shrapnel while cutting. It handles the ribs on the metal with ease. Wish I’d bought this years ago when putting a similar metal panel on a roof!
customer_reviews.author: J. Morse

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 at a great price and have been very happy with 100's of cuts one one blade so far. Will update on longevity when I finally have to replace the blade.
customer_reviews.author: N E

customer_reviews.title: Much better than blade that came with my saw
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut plywood and 2x4s so far. Clean cuts and easy handling. Better quality than factory roybi blade.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Check width of riving knife
customer_reviews.text: Love this blade.. cheap, teeth like a shark, clean cuts on everything I've pushed through it. Beware of your riving knife.. had to adjust mine as the kerf from this wasn't wide enough and wood would bind mid cut =\ Thinking about buying another for my miter saw :)
customer_reviews.author: Happystains

customer_reviews.title: Will not cut 3/4" plywood
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this blade. I bought it for use on a portable saw to break down large sheets parts of 3/4" birch plywood. The blade would not cut through it! I haven't tried it yet on 1/2" of 1/4" or even solid wood, so can't say.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Good blade for wood and sheet goods.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new blade for my Ridgid miter saw. This one seemed to be a bargain so I gave it a try. I've used it to cut all kinds of wood, siding, and thin sheet metal. Worked great. I'm kinda hesitant to cut thicker metal.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping good blade
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pricing that others were selling for in some cases at double the price. Arrived promptly and fit perfectly in a sealed package.
customer_reviews.author: riky1

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, for a few cuts
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save a few bucks but should have known better and bought the red blade, ended up doing that to finish the job anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this blade for a quite some time now and I have used it to cut the sheet metal roofing on my new house plus a lot of aluminum flat bar still works great
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Mines made in Italy it looks like
customer_reviews.text: Mines made in Italy? Perhaps they have changed manufactures again. @amazon - please help. Iam unable to post pictures in my review
customer_reviews.author: Phil Tran

customer_reviews.title: Nice Heavy duty Metal cutting Blade
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews and decided to buy this blade. I am glad I did. It works really well on an initial cut or a cut where there is at least 1/2 inch to cut off. It would work on a shorter cut area on thicker material but I was cutting 29g sheet metal. I have cut a lot so far w/ this blade w/ no signs of dulling. Hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done right
customer_reviews.text: This blade did a great job fixing a problem. Metal roofing was send to house 3ft. to long. Bought this blade to do the job. The blade was able to cut 3 sheets at a time for a total of 36 sheets before it became to dull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and clean
customer_reviews.text: Used for ripping and crosscutting 29 gauge metal roofing. Much faster and cleaner than an abrasive wheel. Use ALL the PPE when cutting with this blade!
customer_reviews.author: weirdbeard

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done....barely.
customer_reviews.text: Did the job but blade dulls quickly. I have to keep ordering these because they will only cut 6 laminate floor boards before they are 2 full to use. Unfortunately no one near me has these in stock.
customer_reviews.author: LAWSONRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: It lasted a half hour and then I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: william sarlitto

customer_reviews.title: Chop saw replacement blade
customer_reviews.text: It seems that 81/4 in blades are not a particularly popular size and selection is limited. I have this old Delta compound miter that holds more sentimental attachment that woodworking functionality. I have no experience with Irwin Industrial Tool products and purchased this one based on specs and price. Installation was easy enough. The blade appears finely milled and crafted. I guess proof is in the cutting. It cuts well and makes the 25 year old Delta saw operate like new again. Nice blade. Nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for lexan
customer_reviews.text: I use this blade to cut lexan on a Dewalt cordless circular saw. Leaves the edge smooth and not melted.
customer_reviews.author: Shoboy

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Dr. Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Amazing blade. I put it to the test by cutting 21 sheets of heavier guage metal siding at one time. I was astounded. Repeted cutting another 2 stacks of 21. Then went on to cut various +- 20 single sheets throughout the day. Only on my last 3 rake cuts did I have to switch to my abrasive blade. It was well worth the cost in the time and effort it saved. Not sure what it would cost to resharpen. Will definitely use this type of blade when or if I need to do another large metal project.
customer_reviews.author: Lancelot

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, but same price in the box stores
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor, over 10 years. Did my first vinyl siding install job... Hate the stuff, love taking it off tho 😈 heheh. But whatever the client wants I suppose.... At any rate, great blade, worth every penny. Cut every square foot with this blade, don't feel like I dulled it a bit!
customer_reviews.author: Roser

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: This blade is the bomb. I have cut metal roofing with nibblers, composite blades, steel blades, but this blade the best by far. I cut through seven sheets of 24 ga. at once, with the best cut quality of anything I have used to date. Be sure to wear hearing and eye protection! I have not cut single sheets, or tried to trim a little off the edge or anything, just two cross cuts with 7 and 4 sheets of roofing, but it paid for itself after the first pass.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: best blade i ever used, cutting with that made me have saw blade fantasies!
customer_reviews.text: ripping 2x4 into 4 different fence boards for building a cheap priced fenced, the blade made me look likei knew what i was doing, i choose the blade over a woman any day :) !
customer_reviews.author: Felicia paden

customer_reviews.title: Great return policy.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 5 stars only because I misread how many teeth were on the blade. Thought it was 80 teeth, not 180. My fault. Thank goodness for Amazons great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Best Blade out there
customer_reviews.text: Run an interior trim company and my guys love these blades. Nothing better out there that they use! A+ seller. Always keeps pricing good around $70.00 Thank you for stocking this, will always buy from you. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maka Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't tell you how thick of metal its good for.
customer_reviews.text: When it cut it did well. There is nothing in the packaging or description about how thick of metal this can cut through. I used it on 3/16th and it didn't last long, like 4 cuts.
customer_reviews.author: rusty wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to cut corrugated metal roofing into skirting for around our house. This blade really cuts right through it quickly and easily. I think it was a great buy and an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beaucher

customer_reviews.title: Wore out after 3 cuts
customer_reviews.text: Wore out too fast. Wasted $42. I cut three 6 inch custs in 1/4" 300 series stainless when it stopped cutting and over heating my saw motor. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: DRod

customer_reviews.title: The Best metal sheet blade
customer_reviews.text: Cut's through metal sheets with ease. You will want to wear protection. Excellent blade for what it is intended for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts smooth
customer_reviews.text: Most stores don’t have a big selection of 6.5” blades. Decent brand. Cuts smooth in plastic and vinyl fencing.
customer_reviews.author: Stan K.

customer_reviews.title: Good price for this blade
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize how dull my old blade was. Cuts clean, neither Home Depot nor Lowes carried this size so I was glad to find it online.
customer_reviews.author: Bobkat

product_meta.title: IRWIN Tools Metal-Cutting Circular Saw Blade, 12-inch, 60T (4935558)
product_meta.description:
Laser-cut blades and anti-vibration vents keep the blade cool for smooth and accurate cuts. Metal cutting-grade carbide teeth withstand impact, reduce wear, and deliver longer blade life. Cuts the metal instead of grinding it like abrasive wheels, so the finished product is smoother and cooler to the touch. The metal cutting blades also last significantly longer than abrasive wheels making the cost per cut lower. IRWIN Tools Metal-Cutting Circular Saw Blade, 12-inch, 60T (4935558)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Irwin Industrial Tools 4935558 12-Inch 60-Tooth Metal Cutting Circular Saw Blade for Ferrous Steel is designed for all of your metal cutting needs. The durable metal cutting carbide tips are designed for a smooth and fast cut. These blades are designed to reduce wear, withstand impacts and provide longer life. The blade is stabilized for smooth and accurate cuts and it's anti kickback design reduces dust and sparks for a safer cut. This blade is ideal for the professional who is looking for a blade to provide them with their metal cutting needs.
feature_bullets: Laser-cut blades and anti-vibration vents keep the blade cool for smooth and accurate cuts
Metal cutting-grade carbide teeth withstand impact, reduce wear, and deliver longer blade life
Cuts the metal instead of grinding it like abrasive wheels, so the finished product is smoother and cooler to the touch
The metal cutting blades also last significantly longer than abrasive wheels making the cost per cut lower
